RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the officers: Gary Haston and Jason Cox and Josiah Bennett

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana: truck driver who was stopped by Deputy Cox, identified himself and stated he was not used to driving a truck with a trailer attached, has a history of arrests including drug smuggling, denied presence of dope during questioning, served 9 years in federal prison, drove the truck and trailer to a tire shop, gave consent to search the truck and trailer, was placed under arrest
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston: conducted search, interviewed Saldana, and arranged for a K-9 unit to meet them, received consent from Saldana to search the truck and trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Heather Vargas: participated in search, involved in providing information that led to the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel Martin Huerta: owner of the truck and trailer, first name mentioned by Federico Saldana during the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel A. Huerta: registered owner of the truck, license registered in San Antonio
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jason Cox: involved in the traffic stop and investigation of Saldana, searched for registration documents in the truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel: owner of the truck and trailer, first name mentioned by Federico Saldana
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston and Jason Cox and Heather Va: officers involved in the traffic stop and investigation of Saldana, continued examining the truck and trailer, retrieved twenty four bundles of a compressed white powder that field-tested positive for cocaine
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Josiah Bennett: K-9 handler involved in the search of the truck and trailer, testified about the dog's alerts, understood from the officers that Saldana had given consent to search, used the dog again to search the trailer and the bed of the truck before returning the dog to the patrol car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston and Jason Cox: officers involved in the traffic stop and investigation of Saldana, received consent to search the truck and trailer, temporarily detained Saldana due to increasing suspicions of drug trafficking
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jason Cox and Gary Haston: officers involved in the traffic stop and investigation of Saldana, received consent to search the truck and trailer, temporarily detained Saldana due to increasing suspicions of drug trafficking, developed additional reasonable suspicion of potential drug trafficking through their observations and conversations with Saldana
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston and Jason Cox and Josiah Ben: officers involved in the traffic stop and investigation of Saldana, continued examining the truck and trailer, retrieved twenty four bundles of a compressed white powder that field-tested positive for cocaine
